content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn how to talk about a past holiday using the 'passé composé', the most common past tense in spoken French.
To talk about a completed action in the past, you'll often use the 'passé composé'. It's usually formed with the verb 'avoir' (to have) + a past participle. For example, 'J'ai mangé' (I ate).
For feminine countries like 'la France', 'l'Espagne', or 'l'Italie', use the preposition 'en' to mean 'in' or 'to'.

data.tip: The 'an' sound is nasal, similar to the 'on' in 'song' but produced in your nose.

content.title: Stating Where You Went
content.setting: You're back at work and your colleague, Alex, asks about your holiday.

conversation_flow.title: Greet your colleague and say where you went

extract_info.holiday_location: Extract the country or city the user went to

conversation_flow.title: State how long you were there
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Sympa ! Et c'était pour une semaine ?

content.text: Great! Now let's learn how to add more details about your trip.
In spoken French, it's very common to use 'on' to mean 'nous' (we). The verb is then conjugated like 'il' or 'elle'. For example: 'On a mangé'.

data.tip: The French 'u' sound is made by forming your lips to say 'oo' but trying to say 'ee'.

content.title: Describing the Holiday
content.setting: Alex wants to know more about your trip.

conversation_flow.title: Say what the weather was like
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Super. Et le temps ? Il a fait beau ?

conversation_flow.title: Mention an activity you did
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Parfait ! Et vous avez fait des choses sympas ?

conversation_flow.title: Describe the food
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ça a l'air bien. Et la nourriture, c'était bon ?

content.text: Let's learn how to give your overall opinion and finish the conversation.

data.meaning: I would like to go back there

content.text: The little word 'y' in 'J'aimerais y retourner' means 'there'. It replaces the place you were just talking about, like 'en Espagne'.

data.phrase: Tu as des projets de vacances ?
data.meaning: Do you have any holiday plans?

data.tip: The 't' at the end of 'projets' is silent.

content.title: Giving Your Overall Opinion
content.setting: You're wrapping up the conversation with Alex.

conversation_flow.title: Give your overall opinion of the holiday
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ah, c'est le plus important ! Alors, c'était de bonnes vacances ?

conversation_flow.title: Say you would like to go back
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ça fait plaisir à entendre. Tu aimerais y retourner ?

conversation_flow.title: Ask if they have any holiday plans
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Je comprends. Moi, je ne sais pas où aller cet été.
